cause.description:
Services: C.A.S.E. provides counseling service, support, and education for adoptive parents (including prospective and waiting); adopted childen, adolesants, and adults and their families; birth families; and children in foster care awaiting permanent adoptive homes.
Who are we?
Founded in 1998. Founder - Kathy Dugan, mother of 12, 8 adopted, 6 from the child welfare system. Unique, one of a few in the country, not attached to an adoption agency. Specialize in post-adoption support services including counseling, consultation, training, education, publications and advocacy. Focus/Passion - helping adoptive families and children from a variety of foster and adoptive backround to recieve understanding and support which will enable them to grow into successful, productive adults. Staffed with experienced, award winning, and dedicated clinicians - passion for advocating, ensuring the health and permanacy of adoptive families.
1. There are over 2.5 Million adoptees in the U.S.
2. 58% of Americans know someone who has been adopted, has adopted and child, or has relinquished a child for adoption.
3. There are 41,878 adopted children in Maryland (Over 7,300 adopted children in Motgomery County)
4. Adoptive Children's needs don't end with signed adoption papers - reaserch supports value of early intervention and support!
cause.mission: C.A.S.E. is a non-profit organization serving the greater Washington areas. We strengthen the well being of children and families of all adoptive experiences.
cause.name: Center for Adoption Support & Education
